Comments_List: I generally learned more about ethical topics in science. Specifically, I learned more about how to navigate potential issues as a graduate student.
I learned a ton about topics like "choosing a mentor" and "how grants work," but not as much in the actual ethics portion of the class
We learn how to design and conduct the experiment in a proper way.

This course is very dependant on the professor directing the topic and discussion each week. Some times they are quite beneficial (I.E Choosing a Mentor with Sam Katz) and other times they are not. 
I think this course would benefit a lot from being structured or designed by someone with a bioethics background as I think it was a space to discuss topics of interest to researchers but not necessarily a course that dove into the ethical implications and context of research in society. 
It was beneficial in that it brought up topics relating to ethics and that were good to be aware of when going into academia. The way they were discussed though was in a forum style and less intellectual than I would have liked.

The lecture on choosing a mentor was very helpful and should be given during orientation, before choosing rotations. 

The lecture on grants/NIH procedures was also incredibly helpful. 

Final paper was entirely unnecessary.
I think debate should be facilitated better. Most of the classes the conversation was only facilitated by a few students and the professor took a passive role.

I think this class would be better in the fall semester. A lot of the conversations we had would be really helpful when you're starting your first year, but some of the conversations like "how to choose your mentor" came a little too late.

Strengths: the topics are not far away from our lives.

Weakness: I actually don't know what the reaction paper is (it seems that not every lecturer ask questions during the class), it is might be helpful to indicate or explain it a little bit more in the beginning of the class.
Different PI were invited, so we can learn their own opinion.
If the student had previous training in ethics, this course is not useful.
Yes, I think every scientist should take this course.
